page.title: 05Life in Hopton.
page.content: After eighteen years we still live at Town End House owned by the Gells who were one of the great Derbyshire landowners in the 16th Century.Like many others we were attracted by the quiet and hilly landscape though work is far away and it costs a great deal to run a car ten miles.There are 17 households here.It is a popular place to live now with the prospect of the reservoir,though still empty with its broken dam.It can be lonely place for there is no seat in this shop,no blacksmith's fire to sit by. There is a library van,doctors and buses 3 times a week. After the wettest summer for years many are depressed but hunger won't follow in our country. Each tree dead of elm disease strikes like the death of a friend.We welcome the rooks, listen to the owls.A place for a tranquil childhood.
